metadata.title: CVE-2024-36893 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usb:typec: tcpm: Check for port partner validity before consuming ittypec_register_partner() does not guarantee partner registration to alwayssucceed. In the event of failure, port->partner is set to the error valueor NULL. Given that port->partner validity is not checked, this results inthe following crash: Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference atvirtual address xx pc : run_state_machine+0x1bc8/0x1c08 lr :run_state_machine+0x1b90/0x1c08 .. Call trace:run_state_machine+0x1bc8/0x1c08 tcpm_state_machine_work+0x94/0xe4kthread_worker_fn+0x118/0x328 kthread+0x1d0/0x23c ret_from_fork+0x10/0x20To prevent the crash, check for port->partner validity before derefencingit in all the call sites.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required
